sub_title: Assistant Professor School of Business and Economics | Scientific Director DEXLab
summary:
I am an Assistant Professor at Maastricht University, where my current research focuses on the effects of using emerging technologies (AR / VR) in online or offline retail environments and how digital technologies affect consumer's sensory and mental decision-making processes. I am co-founder and scientific director of the DEXLab.

Outside of the workplace, I am dedicated to the sport of Lacrosse. If it is not playing, coaching, or organizing anything around Lacrosse, I like to do sports as running, diving, surfing, or playing soccer.

treasury_media.title: Augmented Research | Global AR Research Group
treasury_media.description: Augmented Research. We uncover the value of Augmented Reality (AR) technologies for consumers, marketers, and industrial users. Augmented Research is a global team of researchers dedicated to building the AR business case and developing the AR...

education.field_of_study: Marketing & Consumer Behaviour in an Augmented Reality context
education.grade: Dean's Award for Outstanding PhD Thesis (Top 10%)

awards.title: ANZMAC Best Paper Award
awards.description:
Best paper award at the ANZMAC conference in Melbourne, 2018 in the track Food, Wine and Leisure Marketing
Title: The Effect of Inner Packaging Colour (Patrick van Esch and Jonas Heller)

awards.title: Postgraduate Council Outstanding Research Student Award
awards.description: These awards recognize outstanding supervisors and Higher degree research (HDR candidates who make a difference to the UNSW HDR community.

awards.title: UNSW Business School Student Research Fair Poster - 1st place
awards.description: Annual postgraduate research poster competition. UNSW Business School PhD and MPhil students should present an aspect of the research they are undertaking for their thesis. Got awarded the 1st place among 40 other candidates.

awards.title: ANZMAC Strategy Challenge - 1st place
awards.description: The ANZMAC Strategy Challenge pits the best minds from leading universities against each other, in a winner-take-all online strategy simulation. In 2017, several universities from Australia and New Zealand competed, with the University of New South Wales taking the prize. The winning team – Jake An, Vicki Andonopoulos and Jonas Heller – were relentless in their development and implementation of cutting-edge strategy.

awards.title: Best Paper Award
awards.description: The Competitive Advantage in the Digital Economy (CADE) Forum is an exclusive three-day event, bringing together academics and practitioners to discuss the challenges of the digital economy and present the latest cutting edge research.

awards.title: International Postgraduate Research Scholarship (IPRS)
awards.description: The objectives of the IPRS scheme are to attract top quality international postgraduate students to areas of research strength in Australian higher education providers (HEP); and to support Australia's research effort.

awards.title: Supplementary Scholarship
awards.description: For UNSW Business School applicants who are awarded an IPRS through UNSW, the UNSW Business School offers a Supplementary Scholarship.

awards.title: ASB Lab Small Projects Grants
awards.description: The lab has provided funding to assist Higher Degree Research (HDR) students in running experimental studies in the Lab. The Small Project Grants (SPG) range in value from $1000 to $3000. Received the grant in 2016 and 2017.
awards.issuer: University of New South Wales BizLab - 2x $3.000

awards.title: Master of Science - Cum Laude
awards.issuer: Maastricht University - School of Business and Economics

awards.title: Top Thesis
awards.description: Top thesis at the School of Business and Economics: Buyers Better Be Social - An empirical study on the impact of social media use on buyer’s job performance
